channel.title: All axoloti song, plus the synth patch used
channel.description: Hi all, Completed my first all axoloti tune (well, apart from a little eq/compression in the laptop). https://youtu.be/x-8moOSjgk0 The synth patch I used for all synth parts is here= mandy.axp (59.3 KB) Nerd notes: I first made the drum patterns in my axoloti sample based drum machine, then recorded audio whilst I jammed with the patterns (kick on one track, snare and hats on the other). Then I fed the audio through my live sampler/filter patch a couple of times, recording audio while I played around with knobs/triggers. The patches were the ones on this thread- https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/3-axoloti-guitar-bass-drum-machine-setup/5267 Then, I recorded the midi for the keyboard parts on the laptop, did a little tidying and fed the midi back through the synth linked above. I did this multiple times for each synth part, sending the same midi through different synth settings and playing with the knobs whilst recording. Then I mixed the resulting audio, with a bit of compression/eq here and there. Put a master limiter on, and it was done. Hope you like it!

@reubenfinger wrote:

Grand work Matt, some nice changes and good pace, accompanied by what I had assumed was some sort of Grand Theft Auto Glowstick spree, but then like a Ben Wheatley film, it slowly devolved into some local satanists glaring at you, spent yet enboldened from their sacred pagan rite coming in yer Crib fer a Kill, or at least a swig of Mattilyn

item.title: All axoloti song, plus the synth patch used
item.dc:creator: @MattilynMattroe
item.description:
@MattilynMattroe wrote:

Hi all,

Completed my first all axoloti tune (well, apart from a little eq/compression in the laptop).

The synth patch I used for all synth parts is here=

mandy.axp (59.3 KB)

Nerd notes:

I first made the drum patterns in my axoloti sample based drum machine, then recorded audio whilst I jammed with the patterns (kick on one track, snare and hats on the other). Then I fed the audio through my live sampler/filter patch a couple of times, recording audio while I played around with knobs/triggers.

The patches were the ones on this thread-

3 axoloti guitar/bass/drum machine setup Your Music/Projects
Thought I'd share the jam set up I've been working on for the last couple of months. Still tweaking it, but it's coming together nicely. It's 3 axolotis running: Sample based drum machine with a 64 step sequencer with quantized live midi recording. 2x audio loopers, each with it's own reverb and it's own synced delay with filter and time modulation. One Looper also goes through 4 filters (2 lo pass and 2 hi) which are triggered via midi, cut off is controlled by note. It also goes throuâ€¦

Then, I recorded the midi for the keyboard parts on the laptop, did a little tidying and fed the midi back through the synth linked above. I did this multiple times for each synth part, sending the same midi through different synth settings and playing with the knobs whilst recording.

Then I mixed the resulting audio, with a bit of compression/eq here and there. Put a master limiter on, and it was done.

Hope you like it!
